alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 24 at 11:02AM CDT until October 30 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse zones. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Waves of rainfall are expected through Thursday night with central into western Wisconsin north of Interstate 90 the main target area. There could be 3 to 5 inches of rain that falls this week. However, this forecast rainfall could shift yet. If the rain does fall, the rivers could flood. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Black River near Galesville. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding mainly impacts wildlands and agricultural pasture land. However the approach to the south end of the County Road VV Bridge over the Black River may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT.
